solution_line_template: There are {fifth_graders} fifth graders + {sixth_graders} sixth graders + {seventh_graders} seventh graders = <<{fifth_graders}+{sixth_graders}+{seventh_graders}={total_students}>>{total_students} students going on the trip.

There are {teachers_per_grade} teachers + {parents_per_grade} parents = <<{teachers_per_grade}+{parents_per_grade}={adults_per_grade}>>{adults_per_grade} adults going on the field trip for each grade.

There are {number_of_grades} grades going, so {number_of_grades} grades x {adults_per_grade} adults/grade = <<{number_of_grades}*{adults_per_grade}={total_adults}>>{total_adults} total adults going on the trip.
There are {total_students} students + {total_adults} adults = <<{total_students}+{total_adults}={total_people}>>{total_people} people going on the trip.
